heart_rate_reader module¶

heart_rate_reader.calculate_values(times, values)¶
Calculates metrics:
mean_hr_bpm, voltage_extremes (max, min), duration of data, num_beats, beats [times]
Parameters:
  • times – [float] array of times corresponding with voltage values
  • values – [float] array of voltage values corresponding with times
Returns:

metrics dictionary, message (stating if metrics are weird)
heart_rate_reader.find_peaks(times, values)¶

” Simple Peak Detection - finds the local max of series of consecutive values above a certain threshold, calculated relative to the global max Helper method to calculate_values

Parameters:
  • times – [float] list of times corresponding with values
  • values – [float] list of voltage values corresponding with times
Returns:

peak_times [float] list of times corresponding to local maxima (voltage peaks)
heart_rate_reader.main()¶

Main function for heart_rate_reader.py Loops through each test_data file and saves in results folder

heart_rate_reader.parse_data(file)¶

Parses data from file and gives cleaned (noise reduced) version of times, voltages

Parameters:file – (string) path to csv file to be parsed
Returns:avg_times [float]: list of running avg times corresponding with voltages avg_voltage [float]: list of running avg voltages corresponding w/ times all_times [float]: list of all times in csv file all_voltages [float]: list of all voltages in csv file
heart_rate_reader.save_json(data, save_path)¶

Saves the data inputted as a json file to the save_path specified

Parameters:
  • data – dictionary of metrics to save
  • save_path – path to filee (ie where to save json file)

bme590hrm
